concept.title: WebHelp Publishing Template
concept.shortdesc: WebHelp Publishing Template defines all aspects related with the look and feel(layout and styles) of the WebHelp Responsive output.

conbody.draft-comment: Should explain the publishing template concept from the user perspective without many developer notes.

section.title: Easy to share with others
section.p: A WebHelp Publishing Template was designed as a self-contained package stored either as a ZIP archive or as a folder on disk.
This method allows you to easily share the publishing template with other people. The common uses cases are:

dlentry.dt: Develop a Publishing Template and Share it with others
dlentry.dd: Because the publishing template is stored in a ZIP archive, it is easier for a developer to share its work with others by sending a ZIP archive. On the other hand, the template users will add the template in gallery so it will be visible on the next time when they display the Transformation Scenario dialog.
Moreover, A publishing template allows you to specify a name, description and author making the communication between developer and users more easier.

dlentry.dt: Share Publishing Template with Your Team

dd.p: The easiest way to achieve this is to use a template gallery for your project.

This implies to:
copy your template in a folder, lets say webhelp-templates.
open the DITA/Publishing preferences page and add the above folder to the template galleries list. To share the same preferences with your team, switch the DITA/Publishing preferences page as project level.

dlentry.dt: Develop a Publishing Template and use it in an Automatic Publishing System
dlentry.dd: Another use case is that you can develop a publishing template in oXygen XML Editor/Author. Once you have define it, you can export it and use it in an automatic publishing system like Jenkins or Travis.

section.title: Easy to upgrate to a new version
section.p: Another benefit of this customization method is it allows you to easily upgrade from an older version of .
A publishing template is external to the WebHelp plugin or oXygen XML Editor/Author. So, it won't be necessary to compare the WebHelp plugins to merge your customizations.

section.title: Tightly integrated with oXygen XML Editor/Author
section.p: The and publishing template concept are tightly integrated with oXygen XML Editor/Author helping you to:.

sectiondiv.p: You can store your custom templates in a templates gallery. The templates stored in the gallery will be presented in the transformation scenario dialog as first items.
You can define your templates gallery by going to the DITA / Publishing preferences page and adding more entries in the Additional Publishing Templates Galleries list.

section.sectiondiv: Publishing WebHelp output using a templateThe predefined publishing templates and the ones collected from the template gallery are presented in the transformation scenario dialog.
So, you simply select a template and apply the transformation to get the WebHelp output associated with the template.

sectiondiv.p: A publishing template is stored either in a ZIP archive or in a folder. If it is a ZIP archive, you can extract it in a folder and link it in Project view. Using the project view, you can manage its resources.
To edit the publishing template descriptor, you can open it in the editor. The content completion and validation support will help you to edit it.
